lead_paragraph: Exit surveys offered a portrait of the first wave of American voters to cast ballots in a primary election this year.

byline.contributor: Megan Thee-Brenan and Dalia Sussman contributed reporting.

headline.print_headline: Polls Show Terror Fears Aided Trump and Youth Helped Propel Sanders
headline.main: Primary Exit Polls Show Terror Fears Aided Trump and Young Voters Helped Sanders

snippet: Exit surveys offered a portrait of the first wave of American voters to cast ballots in a primary election this year.
abstract: Exit polls in New Hampshire indicate two-thirds of Republican voters concur with Donald J Trump's proposal to temporarily ban Muslims from entering country, and overwhelming number fear terrorist attack; Bernie Sanders wins state's Democratic primary on strength of young voters' concerns over inequality and political trustworthiness; results do not predict how Sanders's campaign will fare in Southern and Midwestern state primaries, where Clinton enjoys strong support across broad voter base; chart breaks down results by demographics.
